intro: Leptosiphon rosaceus, commonly known as the pink evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Leptosiphon rosaceus is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
